page.title: 12Changes in Bridgham
page.content:
Bridgham has changed greatly over the last 50 years. Before the last war, nearly all the inhabitants worked in or around the village - as farm or forestry workers. Most were Bridgham born, or came from nearby villages and lived in council or tied houses. Much more land was used for cattle and sheep and fewer machines were used, so much labour was required. Families were larger too. The church was well attended and Bridgham had its own Rector, not shared with East Harling, as now.
The village had two general stores and a Post Office. Most people shopped here, or in East Harling. Transport to Thetford was difficult and villagers walked or used bikes. A wealthy few had cars. Bridgham was then a fairly self sufficient village.
